attributes.comment:
Please DO NOT increase the petition fees for adoption. Adoption is already a very
expensive process for those seeking to provide a loving home to orphans. The
proposed fee increases would be overly burdensome to those seeking to provide a
home to orphans.
Frequently, adoptive parents must file TWICE because the overseas processes
take longer than the 18 months the forms are valid. A solution would be to
PERMIT RENEWAL without charging another fee.

Here is what it costs a couple to file with USCIS just to adopt:
What it used to be:
I600A: $545
Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140
Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer (file twice) plus the increase in
fees:
I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340
Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320
Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 (over 140%!) This does not even take into account the
fact that applying for our child's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) goes from
$215 to $460, a difference of $245 (about 120% increase).

Please help us to reach out to orphans in love without overly burdensome fees!

Thank you for your time and consideration,
Roberto and Laura V.
Adoptive parents
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Adoptive Parent, Roberto and Lau Vazquez
